greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of non-averaging permutations of [n] with first element n.
comment: A non-averaging permutation avoids any 3-term arithmetic progression.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..99
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Nonaveraging Sequence
Index entries related to non-averaging sequences
maple: b:= proc(s) option remember; local n, r, ok, i, j, k;
for j in s minus {n} do ok, i, k:= true, j-1, j+1;
while ok and i>=0 and k<n do ok, i, k:=
not i in s xor k in s, i-1, k+1 od;
mathematica: b[s_] := b[s] = Module[{n = Max[s], r = 0, ok, i, j, k}, If[Length[s] == 1, 1, Do[{ok, i, k} = {True, j - 1, j + 1}; While[ok && i >= 0 && k < n, {ok, i, k} = {FreeQ[s, i] ~Xor~ MemberQ[s, k], i - 1, k + 1}]; r = r + If[ok, b[s ~Complement~ {j}], 0], {j, s ~Complement~ {n}}]; r]];
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 14 2017
